question: I am a 31 year old female with a very clean medical history,  I have only had 2 stays in the hospital..one to deliver my son ( I spent 5 days in for preeclampsia), and one to remove my gallbladder which was diseased.I have recently noticed a group of symptoms that I cannot seem to control on my own.  I have had a fever off and on for the past 2 weeks reaching no more than 102F.  I have had a sinus problems, which is not uncommon for me, I fight with my sinuses constantly and have for years.  I have had a dry cough for about 10 days which wakes me up at night.  I cant expel anything from my chest, but I can't stop coughing to the point of triggering my gag reflex.  My airway feels very tight and restricted in my chest and the coughing seems to "stretch" it out, if you will.  I have had around 6 straight days with a severe headache that comes back each day.  Tylenol barely takes the edge off.  I also have bouts of dizziness and blurred vision.  It actually feels as though my eyes can't keep up with my head movement. If that makes any sense.  I turn my head and it looks as though every thing in the room is spinning in circles trying to catch up to the position of my head.  This even occurs when I lay down and close my eyes.  The blackness that you see when your eyes are closed seems to spin and swirl around.  This is very nauseating.  I have pain in my eye sockets when I move my eyes.  I just attributed that to eye strain because of the vision issue.Also, over the last week or so, I have noticed that when I sit down, I feel a pulsating vibration in my left leg.  I first noticed it when I was sitting outside and I thought that someone had a vehicle running and that I was feeling vibrations through the gound up into my leg.  But this continued in the house and has lasted for days.  It still hasn't gone away.I have been noticing that I am having some memory problems too.  I don't remember things as well as I could 1 year ago.  I can't seem to put my words together properly when making a sentance.  It takes me a while to actually get out what I need to say.  If I am reading something out loud to someone, I usually read quite fast - language has always been my strong suit - but now when trying to read I run words together slurring my speech and making absolutely no sence.  This is very frustrating to me because I have always been very proficient in this area.  It doesn't happen all the time, but my husband and I do notice the change.Also, possibly not related to the other symptoms, I have had an irregular heartbeat since I was a teenager.  It got much worse when I was pregnant.  It improved after the baby was born, but 13 months later, the palpatations and skipped heartbeats are happening again very regularly (2 or 3 times a day).  Just makes me nervous to have my heart feel as though it stops beating, I lose my breath, and then my heart beats 2 or 3 times very hard and fast seeming to be trying to catch up the beats it lost.  I don't know what is going on with me, if anything at all.  It may all just be in my head, as they say.  I do have some hypochondriacs in my family and I don't want to be making a mountain out of a molehill, but I would like some answers or at least some advice.  Thanks in advance.
title: Many symptoms - may not be related..any suggestions?
